text: A clock alarm SOUNDS over TITLES on BLACK.  We HEAR someo clearing congested lungs, coughing up phlegm; a slight cr STOPS both the cough and the alarm.
The cottage is a tiny, peeling paint rat-trap set dead ce on a small ocean front cul-de-sac, surrounded by four mas post-modern mansions.

GEORGE NELSON, 42, squints and shivers as the spotty morn light and ocean breeze enter through an open window.  Bol waves crash against the cliffs outside the room.  A five- wide stack of hand hewed beams are piled pyramid style, making movement in the room next to impossible.  George stands shirtless in underwear and coughs again.  He steps over a pile of tools and stands at the window, facing the sea.  A happy sounding tune by Guster, "WHAT YOU WISH FOR begins with the lyrics: 'Woke up today, to everything gra and all that I saw just keeps going on and on...'
The post-modern house is three-levels of concrete and gla

SAM is sixteen with spiky black hair, a nose ring, two earrings and painted black nails.  The song continues wit '...sweep all the pieces under the bed, close all the curtains and cover my head.'  Sam looks wasted as he clim out of bed and rummages through his dresser, retrieving a empty bottle of prescription drugs; he tosses the bottle. walks to a desk where a half-built model of a house sits unfinished and squeezes glue into a plastic bag and sniff it.  Sam enters the closet and digs into a pile of dirty clothes, pulling out the tie to a robe; he knots it aroun the closet pole and then twists it once to form a noose. slips his neck through the noose and lowers his body; tho we don't see exactly what he's doing below his neck, it's evident through his jerking arm that he's masturbating.
COLLEEN BECK, George's next-door neighbor, is a well maintained blonde in her late thirties.  She walks out of angular concrete mansion, grabs the paper and walks back

This is a minimalist kitchen, with pored concrete walls a stainless steel cabinets.  Colleen drops the paper on the table and walks to the sin wash her hands.  The SONG CONTINUES: '...If this serenade not what you want, it's just how it is...'  Colleen appea distracted for a moment.  She walks outside onto the terr with wet hands, then bolts back in, breezing through the kitchen with purpose.

ALYSSA is sixteen and perfect with strawberry blonde hair white teeth; her head is partially out the bathroom windo Colleen bursts in, eases Alyssa aside and with effort, st her head out of the same high open window.
This is ridiculous!

We must not see exactly what they see, but out the window almost beyond view, a stream of urine arks out from Georg Nelson's beach house bedroom, into the pacific ocean some twenty-feet below.  The piss stops.  Colleen bangs her he trying to get it back inside the house.
ROBIN WEBBER is George's ex-wife, still beautiful at fort She herds two boys, RYAN (8) and ADAM (7), down the hall.
Run downstairs and give your dad a hug.
Why?
He'll be gone for his birthday.
Can we have a party for him while he's gone?
Robin stops and KNOCKS on a bedroom door.
I hope you're showered and ready for school!
A loud CRASH stops Ryan and Adam at the top of the stairs
Robin rushes in and glances around the room for her son.
Sam?!

The closet pole and a long line of clothes have been fell by Sam's dangerous whack-off technique; he's on the floor with the robe tie still around his neck and a pile of shi sprawled over him.  The song continues: '...come out come out, wherever you are, would you do it all over right fro the start, and what you wish for won't come true, you are surprised to love, are you?'  Robin stops at the door, trying to figure out why her son sitting in a pile of his own clothes.  Ryan and Adam join her, looking equally perplexed.

George's dog, GUSTER, is doing his business on the lawn o modern day robber baron, DAVID DOKOS, who exits his house with a briefcase.  He hops into his Mercedes and proceeds chase Guster straight across his well-manicured grass.  Guster easily escapes death and runs off.  George walks o of his shack as David hops the curb, flips him off and dr away.  George waves goodbye.
Stick it up your ass!  Have a nice day.   (glancing around) Guster!
Guster runs to his side as Colleen rushes out of her hous
This has got to stop!
He escaped.  He's going back in.
Does it give you some sort of perverse pleasure to expose your...penis in plain view of my sixteen year-old daughter?
There are no windows facing my...exposure.
George, this is the third time.
The plumber's due out on Friday.
You'll have to explain that to the police.
You were the only neighbor I could tolerate.
I did warn you.
My life is a warning.  I just can't figure out for what.
Colleen shies away from George's stare; he finally turns walks toward the house but stops short as he turns back.
Colleen, how hard was it for you to get your head outside that window far enough to see my dick?

This stops Colleen for a moment; it was difficult.  Georg walks back to the cottage and locks Guster in before step into an old Ford truck and driving off.  Colleen watches drive off, then turns to her house and stares.
PETER WEBBER, Robin's husband, is a distinguished, intimidating man with silver hair and an expensive suit.  LOIS, the maid, serves French toast to Ryan and Adam as R sips tea.
Sam broke his closet.
Peter glances at Robin, who shrugs.
I don't have a clue anymore.  I wish you'd talk to him.  He needs a man.
His father is a man.
A man he respects.
Sam walks into the room from the hall, outfitted in all b with kick ass boots.
Thanks for talking about me behind my back...useful in court.
Are you wearing eye shadow?
Adam, Ryan and Robin check out the eye shadow.
No.
Take it off.
Sam flutters his eyelids in defiance of his stepfather.
Do it now!
If I walk out the door, who's gonna be here tonight for the follow through?
Peter hesitates for just a second.
Have a nice flight.
Sam's out the door with his eye shadow intact.
Queer.
What did you say?
Dad said it first.
Robin focuses on Peter, who simply shrugs.  Adam stands u walks over to his father and gives him a hug.
I get chocolate cake for your birthday.
Are your hands clean?
Adam is quick to back away from his father and lick the fingers of one hand.

George is resting his head against the glass window as he stares out at the blighted landscape leading to downtown Angeles.  A sudden pang tightens his face; he presses his hand against his stomach and closes his eyes.

Sam is alone at the back of the parking lot, sitting on t hood of an old Saab, smoking as two boys, JOSH and MAREK, both seventeen, park a Porsche and pull Alyssa Beck (Geor peeping neighbor) and another girl out of the backseat.
Dude, nice look.
Sam simply nods as Marek and the other girl laugh at his black garb, earrings and eye shadow.
I saw your dad this morning.
Sam drops his cigarette and stomps it out as he stands; h face lightens as Alyssa waves before walking away.
Been thinking?
No.
Forget him!
Two hours a week for three-hundred cash.  The whole summer.  Do the math. (as a dig) They consider that a hatchback or a station wagon?  Oh, that isn't yours anyway, is it?
Josh raises his eyebrows and smiles before walking away. faces the Saab and kicks the bumper as hard as he can.  Suddenly, a boy (COREY) bolts up from the back seat.
I was in total REM, man!

The architectural firm of Benson and Feinsilber occupies entire fortieth floor; George Nelson is their sole model maker.  Rather than offices, most of the space is open, segmented only by portable low walls.  Along the outer wa below the long line of windows, is a shelf filled with amazingly intricate models.  George is alone in a cubicle his own, cutting polystyrene with a hot wire.  STEVEN GAR rounds a corner with a velocity that makes George flinch.
Done...close to done?
I'm doing the grass.
Fuck the grass.  Who said grass?
Steven exits as quickly as he entered, but as soon as Geo goes back to work, Steven pops his head back in.
Burke bided out the Berlin Plaza.  Did he tell you?
I was going to start Monday.
He likes the look of the computer models, anyway.  You take too long. (beat) After you mow the grass, would you mind bringing the house to my office?  I have a presentation to make.
George simply stares as Steven nods and leaves.
Sam is by himself, his eyes closed, listening to music through headphones as Alyssa stops to stare; she visually scans him head to foot, appearing slightly perplexed as a friend passes.
I wouldn't make a habit of it.
Okay.
The friend walks on; after a beat, Alyssa does too.

In the distance, the sun colors the sky a blinding orange it sets.  A Range Rover with blackened windows is parked behind a Porsche.  'TINTED WINDOWS,' an up-tempo tune wit hand clapping by the Pansy Division, begins: 'A bed would a treat/But all we've got is this backseat/Tinted windows a beautiful thing.' Through the front windshield, we can see Marek sitting in passenger's seat with his eyes closed.

Josh, Marek's friend, is sitting on a bench in the park behind the cars. 'A dark secluded spot/In a deserted park lot/Tinted windows are a wonderful thing.'   Suddenly, the passenger door on the Rover opens and Marek climbs out, brushing his hair with his hands before casua checking his zipper.  He closes the door and the car spee away.  Josh walks to Marek and wordlessly they climb into Porsche and drive off.
George is shirtless in his front yard, hand hewing a twen foot beam.  One strong, long pull and a thin shaving flut to the ground; Guster nabs it and starts to chew.
You'll crap real logs if you keep eating wood.
Guster appears unconcerned as he awaits a new shaving.
Hi, Mr. Nelson.
George glances up, wipes the sweat from his forehead as Alyssa walks toward him in white shorts and a tee shirt.
Sorry I got you into trouble.
I'll survive.
George goes back to works and Guster taste tests shavings Alyssa searches for something else to say.
Does Sam have any friends?
George stops and looks up; he has no idea how to answer.
He must.
He seems lonely.
Are you his friend?
No.
Why?
Marilyn Manson...and I guess he's into guys.  I hate nose rings.  And the blue eye shadow thing really isn't working.
George is totally confused, unsure most of the answer, bu before he can question her, a police car pulls to a stop; OFFICER KURT WALKER steps out.
Thought I'd run over the list.
Officer Walker removes a pad from his pocket and flips through to find his place.
This is such a street of whiners.

From Tuesday to yesterday, not including Monday or today.  Okay...Mrs. Dokos is repeatedly running over her lawn.  The Corliss' have attributed the increase in rat population in their environs to the state of your...structure.
IPO's caused the rat population on this street.
Officer Walker focuses on Alyssa.
And of course the Beck's, with the...
It could have been a squirt gun.
(to George) You've been good this week.
You forgot David Dokos and Tom and Barbara.
Kurt stuffs his pad back into his pocket.
Mr. Dokos calls animal control for Guster and I was out here on the other. (pointing to the plane) Do you mind?
George hands him the plane and Kurt begins to work the wo
Are you guys' friends?
We've known each other since grade school.
I mean, but did you both go camping on weekends?  Listen to music?  Masturbate together?  Talk on the phone?
George doesn't answer and Kurt keeps working.
Hunted rabbit in the hills.
Alyssa stares at George, disappointed.
I aimed high.
We just weren't very much alike, I guess.  I don't know. (casually; to George) I liked your dad more than I liked you.
I wouldn't want you as a friend.

George just never really...aimed that high.  Even with not hitting a rabbit.  I  knew you were doing that, by the way.  That's why I stopped doing it with you.  You were no fun.  It was always like you were frightened.  Quiet and boring.
Kurt is beginning to perspire as he shaves food off the b for Guster.
Funny how he's the architect and you're just a loud mouth cop.
He builds models for architects.  His dad, on the other hand, was the real deal.  Designed and built the coolest houses I've ever seen.
Was bankrupt and dead before I was twenty.
Left you this place.
It was in my name so he wouldn't lose it.  He stole it from everyone that deserved it by putting me on title.
Do you know what I'd give to have this!  Forget how I got it!  I can't afford dirt in this town.  I live in Riverside, Goddammitt  And you get to piss in the ocean.
Kurt stops working and steps back.
Your kid was down around Diver's Cover again, smoking pot.  I didn't write him up...told him I wouldn't tell you...
Thanks for telling me.
At least your father tried, George.
Kurt walks to his car and drives off.  There's a moment o awkwardness with Alyssa.  George walks into his house lea Alyssa with Guster.
Robin is sitting at the kitchen counter, cutting carrots; through the French doors, she's able to watch Ryan and Ad along with a few friends, play in the pool.
I could be anyone.
Robin jerks with fright as half the carrots roll to the floor.
Then why do you stay you?
George picks up the carrots and washes them in the sink.
You should lock your doors.
Ring the bell before you try the door.
George bites into a carrot as Robin starts chopping again
Did Sam call to tell you he wouldn't be over this weekend?
You let him pierce his nose?
Robin snatches the carrot from George's hand and chops it
Lock the door behind you.
Where is he?
Where he always is.
George takes Robin's hand and removes the knife.
Not that I don't trust you.
As George lets go, Robin holds on; he appears surprised b her grip of his wrist.  Robin's eyes well with tears.
I should have knocked.
George is clearly not comfortable with his ex-wife's hold him, with her tears.
What kind of a mother can't stand her son?
George jerks his arm away from her grip.
I don't know.
George is tense and he walks to Sam's door and KNOCKS.
Why aren't you coming in for the weekend? (beat) Sam?!
Nothing.  George tries the door - it's locked.  Frustrate he walks back down the hall and down the stairs.

Outside, the boys are engaged in a raucous version of Mar Polo.  Robin is at the sink; she holds her hair back with hand and splashes water on her face with the other.  Geor walks by outside, carrying a ladder.
Ryan is the first to notice  George.
Marco!
What are you doing?
I'm not cheating!  I'm not looking!
Robin wipes her face with a hand towel as she rushes out.
What are you doing?
He doesn't answer.
The boys have stopped playing; Adam opens his eyes.
He never answers.
Why does he have a lock on his door?
Because he put the lock on!  Do you think I told him he could have a nose ring?!  Why do you ask me everything you should ask him!?  I don't know anything, anymore!
The boys line up against the edge of the pool and watch George extend the ladder against the house and climb.

You climb up there and tell him what he can and can't do.  Take him for the summer, okay?  Whip him into shape.  Cut his hair.  Make him smile.  Let him hate you for a while! (sadly) You're too late for heroics, George.

George lops a leg over the railing and steps onto the bed balcony.  He peers into the room through the sliding glas door and tries to open it (locked) before removing the sc to the small open window beside it.  He climbs in.

Sam is asleep on his bed in his underwear, wearing headphones.  On the floor is an aerosol can of whipping cream.  George picks up the can and tosses it in the tras He focuses back on his son with his nose ring, earrings, eyeshadow and thin, pale white body.  Sam is soundly asle George gently removes the headphones from his son's head; drum heavy music surges from the small, padded speakers.
You need every brain cell you've got.
A KNOCK on the door stirs Sam more than his father's voic
(half-asleep) Leave me alone!
Sam's eyes are still closed as he shifts onto his side.  George opens the door; Robin is weak and weepy.
I don't know what to do, anymore.  Take him.  You take him. (hostile) You're such a good father.
George walks out of the room, around Robin and down the stairs without a word.  Sam stirs at the sound and sits u confront his mother.
What are you doing in my room?
I didn't go in your room.
I locked the door!  Get out!  I locked the door!  Get out!
Robin grabs the door and closes it quickly, but doesn't m
Stupid bitch!  Liar!  I locked the door!  I don't sneak around your room!  Liar!

Sam rushes over to the window and stares down at the scre and ladder.  Ryan, Adam and their friends are still in th pool, holding onto the coping, staring up at Sam.  Sam sl the window shut and searches for the can of whipping crea He gets down on his knees to search under the bed.  Stand and making one more pass of the room, he notices the can the trash.  He instantly focuses all his rage at the clos door.
This is my room!  You have no right in here!  This is mine!
Robin is sitting on the floor at the top of the stairs, staring blankly down at the foyer of this modernist mansi
Why can't you all just die and leave me alone!

The traffic is thick and loud and the sky is a blanket of brown as George makes his way down a sidewalk mixed with professionals and panhandlers.  Suddenly sick, George rus to the side of a building and vomits.

George wipes a clump of wet paper towel against the vomit stain on his cuff as he walks through the pockets of cubi to a large enclosed office.  A SECRETARY smiles as she st up from her desk and opens the door.
Good morning.
Is there a...
He holds out the wad of wet paper towels, but before he c say trashcan, BRYAN BURKE stands up from behind his desk.
George, have a seat!  I've got juice.
George steps in and the secretary closes the door to the office.  Bryan approaches with his arm outstretched, but George can only raise the paper towels.
A bird caught me.
Bryan grabs a trashcan and holds it up; George tosses the ball into the trash and sits down.
Orange juice...croissant?
Bryan motions with his hand as he sits.
I'm good, thanks.
What are you on?
Pardon me?
how much weight have you lost?
Oh...nothing.  Thirty pounds.  I just haven't been very hungry.
How's your wife?
When we divorce a decade ago, she was very, very angry. (beat) Now she's just hostile.
Bryan nods and laughs as he takes a chunk of croissant an chews as he talks.
Right...she married...what was he?
He buys and sells the world.
Peter Webber!  Right.  Quite the spotlight on that guy.
I did tell you, didn't I?  That I'd be ready to start the Berlin model today?
Well, that's sort of...you're sure you're not hungry?
Bryan is anxious as he holds up the rest of the croissant George shakes his head "no".  Bryan tosses his croissant the trash can and leans forward.
This isn't me. (beat) We can show clients endless options, change anything in a matter of hours on the computer.  But you won't change.
Typing and clicking myself to renderings isn't why I started building models.
All of us are typing and clicking, George.  Whether we want to, or not.
I'm not.
Which is why we bid out a quarter of our projects.  It doesn't make a lot of sense anymore to want what we don't have and don't want what we do.
George glances around the office, angered by the thought being fired.
I've been here twenty years.
Maybe that's too long.
(hopeful) Maybe...?
That's too long.
George nods as he stares at Bryan.

Listen, they decided on a week a year severance, but I got them to twenty-six.  That's six months salary, George.  Medical and everything for six months.  You can learn all you need to on the computer long before that.  Maybe find a job closer to home.
Bryan is rattled by George's blank stare.  He takes his g of orange juice and sits back in his chair, taking a sip, the while keeping an eye on George.

My wife left me because I wasn't...very emotional.  I kept trying to explain that my father sucked all the emotion from me.  Drunks do that, sometimes.  Make their kids afraid.  Make them unwilling to express themselves.
Bryan knows he's supposed to say something, he just can't seem to figure out what.
Oh.
How old are you?
Forty.
We were probably in school together.  You went to Berkley?
Bryan lights up at the sound of his Alma matter.
Class of eighty-six!  I didn't know you were there.
I was a sophomore when I got the call my parents were dead.
This is not the direction Bryan had hoped the conversatio was headed.

My dad had a blood alcohol level of .18.  A little high.  Drove right into oncoming traffic.  Killed my mother with him.  A lady in another car.  Hurt her daughter.  A five-year old girl.  I think about her still.
Bryan wants this to end.  He leans forward with a whisper
Listen...maybe I can get you a year.
I hate this job.
What are you talking about?  You love your job.
From the day I started...to today.  Can't stand it.
Bryan is perplexed as George stands.
Then it sounds like I'm doing you a favor.
It may sound that way, but I react out of fear.  My life has nothing to do with what I like or don't like.  You haven't been listening, have you?
I didn't know there would be a quiz, George.
For everything.
Well, I feel better about this now.
Good.  I was hoping for that.
Relieved and not understanding anything about irony, Brya stands and extends his hand.  George shakes Bryan's hand without malice.
I've got one favor to ask.
What can I do for you, George?

I built my first model here when I was twenty.  There are hundreds of them on shelves around the office.  Twenty years of my life.  I was wondering if I might be able to pick a few to keep, to take home?  Only the ones that really mean something to me.
Bryan recoils slightly from the request.

Oh, well...those are...I mean, we don't get to keep our work.  I could maybe ask them if you could choose one.  But, you know, frankly George, you were the best.  Computer models can't begin to match the beauty you gave yours.  They're a part of this firm.  They inspire me.  I go out there and sometimes just stare at something I've designed.  It amazes me.  I would miss that too much. (beat) Look, I may be going out on a limb, but you go out there and look them over, every single one of them and pick the one you like the best and take it with you.  Just run it by me first, just in case, you know...but I'm sure it'll be okay.
Thank you.
Well, it's the least I can do.
Yes, it is.
George nods and leaves.  Bryan looks lost and guilty agai

George walks around the maze of cubicles back to his own. finds an empty box and starts to pack.  Against a wall, a large rack is filled with spools of architectural plans.  George pulls one of the plans down, rolls it out and deta the wooden spool.  Without warning and with a fury hard t fathom, he proceeds to bat and smash a shelf of beautiful rendered models.  Heads pop up in other cubicles as Georg walks out of his own and armed with a frightening rage, methodically attacks model after model resting on shelves just below massive plate glass windows that frame downtow Los Angeles.  Steven Gardner, who asked for his model wit grass, rushes to within feet of George as he witness his creation deconstruct into shards of cardboard and plastic
Mother of God!  Not my house!
George stops for a second to focus on Steven, but Steven smart enough to run.  George continues on with the busine of disassembling his work.
Oh, please, please, no!

The plea is instantly followed by a pathetic low whine.  George works up a sweat as he whacks model after model; portions of plastic walls or window splatter the office a though bombed in war.  Bryan Burke's secretary inches as close as she dares.
Uh...Mr. Burke would like a word with you, George.
George lowers his stick as he faces her.
Oh...okay.
In his office.  When you're able.
Thank you.

With that, George finishes what he began only minutes pri the complete and utter destruction of every model display on every shelf in the office, save one.  Workers huddle together, collectively moaning and moving en mass from th mayhem.  George picks up the sole surviving model in his and cradles it carefully as he walks into Bryan Burke's office.
Bryan cowers behind his desk as George enters with his mo in one hand and the long wooden stick in the other.
I'll take this one, if that's okay?
It takes Bryan a few aborted attempts to answer before he simply nods.
Thank you for going out on a limb and allowing me one.
Bryan nods again, then quivers as George steps forward, l the stick against the desk and extends his hand.
You're a great architect and a miserable human being.
Bryan winces as he extends his hand.  They shake hands an George grabs hold of the stick again.
Thank you.
George walks around the desk and bashes in a model hidden the floor, one that Bryan had obviously wanted to save.
Oh, fuck!
George drops the wooden spool and walks out of the office Bryan garners the courage to stand.
You're not even an architect and you're a miserable human being.
George turns around only long enough to answer.
You're right.  You win.
George closes the door behind him.  Bryan stares down at remains of the model; he gets down on his knees and caref gathers up the pieces.

George is sweating as he walks with his box of personal i under one arm and the model under the other.  Dizzy, he s for a moment and tires to orient himself, glancing one wa then the other before staggering back and pressing himsel against the building for support.  Sweat beads and drops his nose and chin as the song, 'ACROSS THE UNIVERSE' begi by The Beatles.  George sets the box down but clings tigh to the model as he closes his eyes.   'Pools of sorrow, waves of joy are drifting through my op mind, possessing them, caressing me...' George drops face first to the cement, crushing the model beneath him.

George is probed and poked by doctor after doctor.  An ultrasound test followed by a CT scan, followed by a MRI results in more tests. A flexible tube is slid down George's throat as dye is sh into his body.  'Sounds of laughter, shades of life are ringing through my open view, inciting them, inviting me. A long blunt needle is shoved into George's side for a bi of his pancreas.  X-rays are lit and highlighted as docto ponder the specks, the disease.   Finally, George is opened up; nearly bloodless slice thro skin, muscle and fat reveals death. 'Limitless undying lo which shines around me like a million suns, which calls m and on across the universe...'  George is wheeled down a long hall to the critical care u 'Nothing's going to change my world, nothing's gonna chan my world...'
George tries to sit up, but falls back as he closes his e opens his eyes, closes his eyes.
That took care of the pain?
George opens his eyes again as an attractive NURSE enters with a tray of food.
I could kiss you.
The nurse smiles as she lifts the cover off the dinner.
No food.  I'm painless.
She raises George's bed.
What would you do if you had three or four months to live?
The nurse glances over at the other patient in the room, who's sleeping, before answering in a soft voice.
I'd eat a lot of red meat.
Good for you.
The nurse smiles as she sits down beside the bed.  She fi a spoon with corn and aims it for George's mouth; he acce the good will, chews and swallows.
What would you do?
I'd build a house.
George takes another spoonful of food.
What kind of house?
You know what mortise and tenon is?
The nurse shakes her head "no".
I've got every part of it ready.  It's like a jig saw puzzle...all in pieces now, just waiting to make sense.  I've been through design and review...the planning commission, city council.
She feeds George another small spoonful of food.
No one's really said four months is all you have, have they?
Stage four pancreatic cancer.  They haven't even pretended to offer treatment.  You tell me, when would you start eating red meat?
Can you build a house in four months?
I can die trying.
The nurse rests her hand for a moment on George's cheek.
Good for you.
I haven't been touched in years.
Suddenly alarmed by her emotion, the nurse removes her ha and stands back away from George.
I'm sorry, I don't know what that was.
A handshake, or you know, someone pats you on your back through clothes.  Doctors, people who have to touch you.  But not by people who want to.
No.  A friend... your mother?  Everybody gets touched by someone they love.

Isn't that weird?  I mean, I dated a little bit after my divorce, for four or five years.  Six years.  I know when my son was younger...maybe when he was ten or eleven even, he'd run up and wrap his arms around me.

George suddenly stops to catch his emotion.  The nurse ch the door before walking back to George; she brushes back hair with both hands, then fingers the curves of his ears finally resting her thumbs on his lips.
Oh God, I'm married.
Feeling guilty, she flees the room, waking the other PATI
I'm hungry.
I'm touched.

George is resting, eyes closed, sitting on a bench with h box and the remnants of the model beside him.  A black Ra Rover pulls to a stop with a HONK.  George stands to gath his things as Robin steps out of the car, yelling.
I called everyone, everywhere!  You just vanished!  You could be dead!
Thanks for waking me up.  Picking me up.  You're loud today.
You're inconsiderate and absolutely devoid of emotion!
You're the most beautiful woman I have ever known in my life.
Robin is stumped for a second, confused by the words.
What?
I'm not talking just physically.  Even your anger is perfect.
Robin climbs back in the car and slams her door shut.
George sets his box in back and climbs into the front sea Robin takes off.  He closes his door as she runs a stopli
I didn't think you'd know I went missing.
You didn't think someone from your office would call and tell me you wrecked the entire building and threatened people with a baseball bat?!
A blueprint spool.
Where have you been for a week?!
Four days.  I left to think.
What did you do with your dog?
